jproductioncritic

Class JaudioFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • jproductioncritic.JaudioFeatures

  • public class JaudioFeatures
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds static methods that port over jAudio features adapted for the purposes of jProductionCritic.
    Author:
    Cory McKay

    • Method Detail

      • getRMS

        public static double[][] getRMS(mckay.utilities.sound.sampled.AudioSamples audio,
                                int window_size)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the Root Mean Square (RMS) of each window of samples in the specified audio. RMS provides a good indication of the average power of the signal over the window. RMS is calculated by summing the squares of each sample, dividing this by the number of samples in the window, and finding the square root of the result.
        Parameters:
        audio - The audio samples to calculate the RMS of.
        window_size - The window size in samples to divide samples into.
        Returns:
        The RMS values for the given audio. The first index indicates channel and the second indicates window number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a processing error occurs.

      • getRMS

        public static double getRMS(double[] samples)
        Calculates the Root Mean Square (RMS) of the given samples. RMS provides a good indication of the average power of a signal. RMS is calculated by summing the squares of each sample, dividing this by the number of samples, and finding the square root of the result.
        Parameters:
        samples - The samples, which must have a minimum value of -1 and a maximum value of +1. The audio samples to calculate the RMS of.
        Returns:
        The RMS value of the given samples.

      • getSpectralFlux

        public static double[][] getSpectralFlux(mckay.utilities.sound.sampled.AudioSamples audio,
                                         int window_size,
                                         double highpass_fraction)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the spectral flux between adjacent windows of the given size for the given audio (flux values are calculated separately for each channel). Spectral flux is a measure of the amount of spectral change in a signal. Spectral flux is calculated by first calculating the difference between the current value of each magnitude spectrum bin in a given window from the corresponding value of the magnitude spectrum of the preceding window. Each of these differences is then squared, and the result is the sum of the squares.
        Parameters:
        audio - The audio samples to calculate the spectral flux of.
        window_size - The window size in samples to divide samples into. It is suggested for the sake of efficiency that this be a power of 2.
        highpass_fraction - The fraction of low frequencies to filter out before calculating the spectral flux. No such high pass filtering is done if this is not above 0 and below 1. For example, a value of 0.7 means that the lowest 70% of the spectral content will be filtered out before calculating the spectral flux.
        Returns:
        The spectral flux values for the given audio. The first index indicates channel and the second indicates window number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a processing error occurs.

      • getPowerSpectrum

        public static double[][][] getPowerSpectrum(mckay.utilities.sound.sampled.AudioSamples audio,
                                            int window_size,
                                            double[][] bin_labels)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the power spectrum of each window of samples in the specified audio. The power spectrum gives the portion of a signal's power (energy per unit time) that falls with each frequency bin.
        Parameters:
        audio - The audio samples to calculate the power spectrum of.
        window_size - The window size in samples to divide samples into. It is suggested for the sake of efficiency that this be a power of 2.
        bin_labels - This array is filled with the frequency bin labels of the power spectrum during this method's processing. Each bin label indicates the lowest frequency for the bin. This argument is ignored if null is passed to it. If non-null, a double[1][] should be passed to this argument.
        Returns:
        The power spectrum values for the given audio. The first index indicates channel, the second indicates window number and the third indicates frequency bin.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a processing error occurs.

      • getPowerSpectrumValueAtFreq

        public static double[][] getPowerSpectrumValueAtFreq(mckay.utilities.sound.sampled.AudioSamples audio,
                                                     double frequency,
                                                     int window_size)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates the power spectrum value for the bin spanning the specified frequency for each window of each channel in the specified audio.
        Parameters:
        audio - The audio samples to calculate the power spectrum of.
        frequency - The frequency in Hz to find the power spectrum value for. Must be at a frequency that is one half or less of the sampling rate of audio, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
        window_size - The window size in samples to divide samples into. It is suggested for the sake of efficiency that this be a power of 2.
        Returns:
        The power spectrum value for the bin spanning the specified frequency. The first index specifies the channel and the second index specifies the window number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a processing error occurs.
